sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube with an edge length of 6 cm?
message_2:
A sphere inscribed in a cube touches all the faces of the cube. Therefore, the diameter of the sphere is equal to the edge length of the cube. In this case, the diameter of the sphere is 6 cm.

The radius (r) of the sphere is half of the diameter, so r = 6 cm / 2 = 3 cm.

The formula for the volume (V) of a sphere is given by:

V = (4/3)πr^3

Substitute the value of r into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(3 cm)^3

V = (4/3)π(27 cm^3)

V = (36/3)π cm^3

V = 36π cm^3

The volume of the sphere inscribed in the cube is 36π cubic centimeters.
